ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function

Interface ExplanationQueryable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Queryable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsoluteValue, Addition, And, AtomicFunction, BooleanConnective, Circuit, Constant, ElementAt, Filter, Fork, GetSize, IfThenElse, IsGreaterThan, Multiplication, Not, NumberCast, Or, ParameterizedVectorFunction, Split, Subtraction, VectorAnd, VectorApply, VectorBooleanConnective, VectorFunction, VectorOr, VectorOutputFunction, VectorProduct, VectorSum, Window

    public interface ExplanationQueryable
extends Queryable
    Advertises that an object can be queried for lineage using a relation called explanation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PartNode getExplanation(Part part)
      Produces an explanation graph for a given part.
      PartNode getExplanation(Part part, NodeFactory factory)
      Produces an explanation graph for a given part, using nodes provided by a given factory.

    • Method Detail

      • getExplanation

        PartNode getExplanation(Part part)
        Produces an explanation graph for a given part. The method creates a new node factory by itself.
        Parameters:
        part - The part used as the starting point of the explanation
        Returns:
        A node corresponding to the root of the resulting explanation graph. The root of this graph is always a PartNode with part as its part, and the callee as the subject. Other nodes may or may not be attached to this root, depending on the subject and the explanation.

      • getExplanation

        PartNode getExplanation(Part part,
                        NodeFactory factory)
        Produces an explanation graph for a given part, using nodes provided by a given factory.
        Parameters:
        part - The part used as the starting point of the explanation
        factory - The factory that provides nodes
        Returns:
        A node corresponding to the root of the resulting explanation graph. The root of this graph is always a PartNode with part as its part, and the callee as the subject. Other nodes may or may not be attached to this root, depending on the subject and the explanation.
